text: HI Guys I have a quick question am I able to populate a a HubSpot property based on information stored in Hubdb? as an example if a property id i s populated on a contact profile populate X property with information linked to the ID is HubDB?

<@U02M9GZTEGH> *Interesting*, haven't tried it yet. But i would test it first with a `octet-stream` and url-encoded string  like this:
```<a href="data:application/octet-stream,{{ url_encoded_csv }}" download="filename.csv">CSV-Btn-Label</a>```
You can also try: `data:text/csv;charset=utf-8;`  with a blob file, created with JavaScript. But this make things more complicate that might be.

CSV it self is very simple. I wound suggest to create an array of rows for the table content in a seperate <script/> section of your template, and push there all the needed information from from the Hubl QUOTE object into that array. In the end you can join and url-encode that array with JavaScript or HubL, both is possible.
```{% set rows = [
    ["product", "price", "amount", "etc"],
    ["name", "100$",  "13", "etc"]
] %}```
Columns are seperated in CSV with  "," and Rows are seperated with "\r\n". If you dont like to code the string yourself, search for jQuery CSV converter. Would be nice to hear how you sloved it in the end.

If you are having individual users do things that integrate wiht HubSpot, it might be better to use the oauth flow to have a user “sign in”

that being said — I wouldn’t count on all keys to start with pat- — I’d have the input be the entire key you copy
sounds like a great project!

If you’ve ever used your media buttons (play/pause) on your mac and it triggers a youtube video OVER your apple music/spotify --

you can do this thing in chrome to prevent that:
1. In the URL box type: <chrome://flags/>
2. Search for Hardware Media Key Handling
3. Set that to disabled
4. Restart Chrome (should happen automatically)
This persists across chrome profiles in my experience
This happened to me yesterday

I would just say stop watching YT videos Nick, shouldn't you be working :troll:

Though this is good to know so thank you :slightly_smiling_face:
LOL I’m just watching the developer channel videos
awesome <@UK9BKNBD5>! thanks for sharing this idea. i've shared it with our developers and hopefully it's just what we need.

I was watching a custom object vid on the Tubes the other day… then the algo had a suggested video for some star wars stuff. After resisting the temptation for 5 minutes (of the hour long custom object video) I caved and clicked.

Before I knew it I was 30 minutes down the YT rabbit hole :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:

The algo strikes again. May the force be with you all

Hi All, was hoping to get some help on this issue. I'm trying to import some components from my TS React project and use some edited React boiler plate CMS code to send them to HubSpot. Unfortunately I'm having more trouble than I would have thought. The structure of my project is a main folder with `HubSpot_landing` folder holding all of the cms code and a `src` folder holding all of my components for my website. I've attached my `webpack.config.js` which seems to be effectively compiling the TypeScript files and have also copied in my `tsconfig.json` . I'm trying to import a component from my `src` folder over to `HubSpot_landing` , but keep getting module not found errors. The import statement is `import ContactForm from '~/components/elements/forms/ContactForm.tsx'` . Would really appreciate some help on this.

EDIT: Following up here to add more detail

<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CMXUWUY5D/p1663360391764229?thread_ts=1663354320.749309&cid=CMXUWUY5D>

I have a module for an “Abandoned Cart” in my Newsletter templates. Could it be that this template does not exist in the Design Manager and it got somehow installed trough the App from the Marketplace in the background and I have no access to it?

Hi everyone! I am having trouble getting my custom CSS stylesheet to apply to the site I am trying to build. I have tried attaching as a <link> tag in the <head>, as well as attaching the file directly, and neither works. When I go into the inspector, I see the stylesheet is present, but none of the elements I am targeting have the CSS I wrote are changing. It’s not even getting overwritten by other CSS - it’s just not there at all. I have tried this with many different elements, so it’s not just one misspelling or anything. Can you help me understand why this might be? I have checked the minified CSS file and it appears to be just fine - no translation errors into the minified file.
Do you have a link to look at?
thats how i did embed it, and then make sure its not about the cache

<https://app.HubSpot.com/settings/3455752/website/pages/3455752.hs-sites.com/page-templates> this is where I set the CSS - not sure if you’ll have access, lmk if you’re looking for a different link. The site is not live, it’s in draft status
Also here’s some screenshots - where I’m adding the CSS, and also proof that I can see the link tag in the inspector. Thanks for your help!
and that file is empty if you look at it in the browser?
here’s the in-browser view. appears to be fine
Very suspicious. Well I can not see your site, but seems to be overwritten maybe. Did you try something like body {background:red} - just to see?
Just tried that - i don’t see it overwritten anywhere in the inspector
that’s not the whole list, but nothing in there shows the background: red that should have been crossed out if it was being overwritten
wanna try to send me the link, i can not believe hat...
…can you publish it?
let me check if they’re ok with me publishing
ok, it’s published - here’s the link <https://3455752.hs-sites.com/>
:thinking_face:
are you able to embed it differently
it COULD be the missing protocol
how would you suggest embedding it?
what happens if you add the https:// here:
just added that - doesn’t look like it made a difference
i do see it listed with the https:// now tho
Ich sehe das Problem. Wechsle mals das src aus mit href
ah ja
danke schon!
i will try that
that worked! Thank you
i still don’t understand why attaching the file directly through HubSpot backend didn’t work, even when the broken link tag was removed. But it’s working for now
thanks again!
Happy, it works… and if you want to use my template feel free. You find them here: <https://evendigo.com/>
